ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.2_0: a monk who was traveling through the Kosalan country toward Sāvatthī walked through the gateway of a certain village.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.3_0: A woman’s husband also left the village and saw him. He said to him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.8_0: Soon afterwards that woman’s husband also left that village. He asked around,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.11_0: He then followed after them, caught that monk, and gave him a beating.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.12_0: He then sat down at the root of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.13_0: And the woman said to her husband,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.15_0: But I’m going to the other mendicant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.19_0: He then went to Sāvatthī and told the monks what had happened,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.20_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.21_0: “How could a monk travel by appointment with a woman?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.22_0: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.25_0: “... Foolish man, how could do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.26_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.27_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:1.28.1_0: ‘If a monk travels by appointment with a woman, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.6_0: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; one who understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.10_0: if he makes an appointment like this: he says, “Let’s go,” and she replies, “Yes, let’s go, Venerable;” or she says, “Let’s go, Venerable,” and he replies, “Yes, let’s go;” or he says, “Let’s go today,” “Let’s go tomorrow,” or “Let’s go the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.11_0: Even just to the next village:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.12_0: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.1.13_0: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.1_0: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he travels by appointment with her, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.2_0: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he travels by appointment with her, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.3_0: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he travels by appointment with her, even just to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.4_0: If the monk makes an appointment, but he does not express his agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.5_0: If he travels with a female spirit, a female ghost, a _paṇḍaka_, or a female animal in human form, even just to the next village, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.6_0: If it is not a woman, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.7_0: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.2.8_0: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.2_0: if he goes without an appointment;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.3_0: if the woman has made an appointment, but he has not expressed his agreement;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.4_0: if he goes, but not according to the appointment;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.7_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc67:2.3.8_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on appointments, is finished.
